Reviews.Title: “Good Crash Pad - Nice Central Location on the Amstel River”
Reviews.Author: Doodyjazz
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night, and didn't spend much time in the room at all, but it was a nice stay, and such a good location, right behind the Rembrandtplein, on the Amstel river. To get anywhere in the city from here is easy as many trams and busses stop at Rembrandtplein every few minutes. The rooms are old, but clean, private bathrooms, and they will bring breakfast to your room in the morning. Close by are several cafes with Cafe de Jaren right across the river, with a beautiful terras on the water. Just out the front door is Mulligan's Irish Music bar, a fun place, and down the way is Rokerij coffeeshop. Surrounded by much nightlife activities the area is a little noisy, but not a major problem in the room I was in. They have vending machines in the lobby with bier in them, a great bonus when returning to your room after 3am and the cafes are closed. By no means a fancy, frilly place, but once again a great crash pad for the adventurer, in an excellent location, a good value in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: GA L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for the money. They only serve breakfast in the room, but it isn't mend on the site of the hotel. The hotel is situated near the Rembrandtplein that is confiniant, but the alley near the hotel is always busy with drunk and loadly people with is loadly heard in the room. The room are clean but small. The hotel is good for young people but not so good for alderly people.

Reviews.Title: “would not return”
Reviews.Author: juliejones30
Reviews.Content: we were a group of 4 staying there for one night. the location was very good and there was plenty of space inside our apartment however the place was dated and run down with awful decor and furnishings! its fair to say that we werent in the room that long as we were out and about but it was a waste of money and could have got something more luxorious for the samr price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cillu001
Reviews.Content: Very good location. No fancy prices charged so we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: DLTucker
Reviews.Content: Went on a stag do. Rooms were really nice, they were more like little flats although we stayed in a separate part of the hotel 3 doors away from the main part so can't speak for the rest. Did not find it noisy, it overlooked the canal which was nice. They do increase the price on arrival though due to taxes etc which they leave you pretty much no choice but to pay so be warned about that. Overall the price was very reasonable though.

Reviews.Title: “100 euros a night for a broom cupboard - smallest room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JoGUK
Reviews.Content: A very small room for 100 euros a night. However it was very clean & the breakfast which was delivered to the room was more than adequate but due to the lack of space in the room, it was very difficult to sit & eat it. Only one chair at a narrow dressing table & a very narrow window ledge made it a complex manoeuvre! Also there was a lot of noise & bass reverberation at night due to the location of the hotel which was very central for all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Boom Boom Boom there goes the nightclub”
Reviews.Author: REC001
Reviews.Content: Very Basic hotel but good location for the centre except for the largest NIGHTCLUB in Amsterdam behind it. Reception better than room. Attic room you are going up a ladder to get in too. If you want cheap you've got it although you if you pay before hand, get ready for them to try and blag more money from you when there. Charges kept changing throughout the conversation. Pretty sure you can probably do better.

Reviews.Title: “Cant attract people so they thrive on scamming prospective clients...”
Reviews.Author: PRM
Reviews.Content: Unprofessional business/staff. Staff only seemed attentive to email request for reservation but after receipt of credit card details, 1/ they never confirmed my reservation despite repeated requests, 2/ so I sent them a cancellation notice of the reservation 3 months prior to travel, 3/ yet they proceeded to bill my credit card for a reservation that never was. They then feign problems with receiving cancellation notice from me despite my sending them copies of dated emails requesting such. They however could not provide me with similar evidence that they had ever responded with a confirmation. They still refuse to reverse the credit card charges.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and noisy all night long”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravelor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the room without a window. There is a bar next to it, they played loud music all night. We couldn't sleep for four nights. The hotel staff was rude and they just wanted the money ans didn't care about us not being able to sleep. Don't stay in this hotel. Save yourself a headache.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD! They will scam you”
Reviews.Author: ftbl616
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely terrible. I gave them my credit card info to hold the reservation and then we paid in cash upon arrival. After we left the hotel charged my credit card 300 Euros for damage to the room-complete fraud! The whole room was damaged. DO NOT STAY HERE they will try to scam you.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for your typical traveller.”
Reviews.Author: CyrusKing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monopole at the end of September 2009 there was a total of 7 of us. We asked the taxi driver to take us to the front door but he was saying that it was a long route for vehicles to get to which was complete rubbish so after 30 minutes of walking around we found the hotel. I noticed that the hotel was located very close to all the night-life so if your looking for a early night forget it , unfortunately our room was on the bottom floor just above the nightclub the music finished around 4am but then we heard lots of traffic and horns for hours which was crazy. I would recommend that you smoke a lot of pot or drink a high volume of booze before trying to get some sleep. Besides from this the hotel did the job , the rooms were clean and the staff were friendly. I would ask for a room upstairs this time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Great location ever! Value for money...”
Reviews.Author: blink188
Reviews.Content: First of all- Best value for money. the location is amazing i have never had such good location. just behind Rembrandt plain. There was just one thing, They wanted to clean the room so much that they once entered the room without knocking while my friend was getting dressed in the room. I just assume that was by mistake... Small & Cozy, Bomb Location, Cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, room temp. bad, noisy low lifes in adjacent building”
Reviews.Author: ashenc
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel was bad but not horrible. The location is fantastic. I stayed on the third floor which was quite spacious but the heat (I was there in January) left something to be desired. The room was always on the cold side of a normal temperature and for someone who can't tolerate a chilly room it would be intolerable. My window opened up to a residential buidling next door. One night, some people had a party and decided to throw their bottles out their window all night which smashed on the concrete slab below. Trashy fools! The steps to the attic room are steep and there is no elevator option but that wasn't a big deal. Still, when all is said and done, the price is reasonable and the location (On Amstel) is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “terrible rooms ,bad staff and rip off merchants,no one should stay there”
Reviews.Author: australia123
Reviews.Content: we were badly ripped off then threatened with police action so i write this review,i wouldnt let my dog sleep in the undersized sweaty little hell hole rooms they have ,the staff are rude and nosy and people like that dont deserve to run a bussiness of any sort .....dont go your better off on the streets

Reviews.Title: “Apartments nothing like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Janjomc
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Monopole Apartments in Amsterdam. HUGE disapointment. The weather was really cold and no heating in the apartment, our kitchen table was a radiator cover with two odd chairs, the view was off another apartment being decorated. Even though the email confirmation stated we would have a view of the canal. The whole place was a building site from the products piled up in te narrow hallways to the bags of industrial waste stacked everywhere.This is our 6th time in Amsterdam and there will certainly be a 7th but our accomadation will be no where near the Monopole.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: The_Great_Stuartio
Reviews.Content: Pretty poor hotel in general. The rooms were an ok size and fairly clean but everything in them was shabby and battered. Our bathroom door had some rather odd stains on it. The main problem however is that there is a nightclub downstairs that plays music very loudly until 4am every night. This will keep all but the deepest (or drunkest) of sleepers awake well into the early hours. On the plus side the beds were comfortable and the location is wonderful. If it hadn't been for the noise then I think this place would be passable. Unfortunately there is no getting away from it. There are much better options in Amsterdam than this for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “not a wise idea”
Reviews.Author: alchemie
Reviews.Content: Well.. first of all, the pics of the hotel that are shown by real travellers, are fair enough. The room is very small, although almost clean (I say "almost" because the pillow covers and the blanket smell like somebady has been there before me). The bathroom is fine and clean, but small for big persons (I'm a small person, so I didn't have any troubles). The towels have some intrigating stains... If you are very picky, bring your own (I wish I had done that!). It is true they don't change the sheets nor the towels, but if you ask them to do it, they'll do it. Towels hanged means you don't want to replace them, but if they are in the floor, then it means your wanna change them. My room had three bulb lights. Two at the sides of the bed and one in the ceiling. This very last didn't work. Neither the tv. There are two small mirrors: one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom. They are very small, so you won't be able to see how you look, if that concerns you. I asked for a room with a window, and I got this terrible view of a very awful patio (but at least I got to see the sky and the weather!). Althogh necesary, there is no lift in the hotel, so you'll have to find your way in very steep and small stairs. You'll have to do that probably two or three more times if the number of your room is beyond number 3 or 4. So be prepared. Breakfast is served in your room. You set up the hour the day before. For breakfast you'll have a pice of bread, one portion of butter, a small portion of jam, one portion of instant cofee, one portion of sugar, one tea bag, a youghourt and a pot of hot water. Personally, I didn't find it bad at all, but if you are use to big breakfast, it would be a wise idea to go to another hotel. There is a club downstairs that gets pretty noisy. YES, you'll hear it: the glasses of the window, and the mirrors vibrate. Be prepared: the noise stops at 4 am. I highly recomend you to bring an ipod (although you might skip the breakfast if you don't hear the person nocking on your door!) If I ever go to Amsterdam again, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel! Avoid to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen1212
Reviews.Content: A hotel with NO Service, UnPOLITE staff, small, dirty, old rooms, towels with holes in it, a terrible noise all night long because of the disco next door, breakfast was a tablet with plastic bags on it. They wanted cash in advance while checking-in before you were able to see the rooms and to spent 1 night with all that noise .... they know why. Avoid this hotel - for a price of 105 EUR / night you will find a better one in Amsterdam, where staff can treat you like a guest and where you were not forced to sleep in a dirty room with a view to walls and dirt. The hotel and the descrition on the hotel home page is a joke or a fake. Look at my pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Get the Canal VIEW”
Reviews.Author: toronto_416_canada
Reviews.Content: Hello, We are two azn male travelers (Toronto and Montreal, Canada) - first time in Amsterdam - May 10-12, 2007. We asked for a hotel room to face the canal and it was soooooo wonderful...ask for rooms that face the canal - you must ask this in order to view the lovel view - I have attached pictures of the view ... The hotel room washroom was nice and renovated ... however things were falling apart ... like 1) the plastic shower thingy ..but it was ok, not a big deal 2) the facuet came off all a suddde .. but it was ok and I fixed it ... we paid around 230 euros with taxes for 2 nights, breakfast included the hotel is really really good location ... gay bar next to hotel any q's feel free to email me at [--]

Reviews.Title: “Leave this hotel alone - we liked it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: GatesheadMark
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April 2007 and despite feeling aprehensive due to the reviews on this website we found the hotel to be clean with efficient and friendly staff in an excellent location just off the Rembrantplein. We got clean towels daily and breakfast in our rooms at the time we requested. The major selling point of this hotel has to be the location and the view from our room was excellent. The only thing wrong with the hotel is that it is very close to Escape nightclub and the music could be clearly heard on a night but if like us you plan on getting wasted and knocking yourself out on a night with the various herbal delights of Amsterdam then I would recommend the Hotel Monopole for value for money and location.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: eadreel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Easter weekend of 2006. I didn't like the stairs, but those kind of stairs are to be expected in the older buildings. We did have a shower and toilet in our room. The room was small, but clean. I found the staff fairly friendly and can see why they ask for payment upfront. The club next door was loud, but I didn't find it a problem, mostly because I was usually asleep before my head hit the pillow. I would say that if you are expecting quality like a holiday inn or a days inn or some similar american chain hotel, you will be dissapointed. I expected cramped quarters and noise, so for me it wasn't a let down. The location was perfect. We could walk to every museum and attraction in Amsterdam. I will definately stay there again when I go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cowboys!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was due to stay 2 nights at the Monopole with an offer of â‚¬95 per night for a twin room incl breakfast (booked 4 weeks previously). I rang the hotel on the day of arrival to confirm my arrival and to advise them when i was due to arrive. When i arrived at reception, they claimed to have no knowledge of my reservation and claimed that they hadnt received the telephone call. However,, they were more than happy to offer me a double room at â‚¬185 per night!!!!!!! Naturally, i declined their offer and walked out. We ended up in a business suite at the Radisson, with a room overlooking the canal for â‚¬159 per night - which was an excellent offer, given that it was 10pm!

Reviews.Title: “horrible place. Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Should've known when the tourist office rang them up and the guy said he'd only let the room for a minimum of 2 nights that there was something amiss - afterall, if you're not confident that you'll fill hotel rooms in Amsterdam on a weekend in July, then what is wrong with the place...? Horrible horrible horrible. Our room wasn't even in the hotel proper, but about 15 houses further down the road. I don't mind having a loo in the hallway to share, but having to LOCK IT up to prevent unauthorised use - there were signs that someone was using the cupboard under the stairs as a dosshouse - well, that's just a little too much for me. The sheets didn't smell too bad, but definately didn't look clean at all. The whole building looked like a total fire trap and there wasn't even any fire escape instructions or anything in the room, leading me to believe that this wasn't really a hotel room proper, just somebody's pad that they decided to let out for a bit. The place was so bad we didn't even stay in the room for our second night. No chance of a refund though! Staying here was a most expensive and stupid mistake. Please don't make the same mistake we did. CaroleJo

Reviews.Title: “Filthy sheets, would sleep in the streets first!!!”
Reviews.Author: UlsterOgre
Reviews.Content: Found something resembling excrement in the bed. Was promised a refund within a week but am still still waiting after 2 weeks. The streets are cleaner than this place. Avoid at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are from Sweden and we visited the hotel a month ago and stayed for 5 nights. We were asked to pay for our room immediately and we had reserved a 95 euros room -they wanted us to pay 105 euros and didnt like at all that we had fax that said, 95euros. In the fax they promised us the room incl. breakfast -we didnt get any! The rooms were dirty, noisy and the employees are unpolite. They didnt say even one word to us during our stay. I love Amsterdam but I will never go back to that hotel. It was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: creditcard ripp off!!! Stay away from this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As an international journalist originally from Amsterdam (living in Switzerland), I would want to warn everybody to stay away from hotel Monopole and to immediately cancel any reservation made in written form (email with a paper copy of this email in the mail) before the 48 hours deadline the hotel claims to handle !! Hotel Monopole is run by an unreliable non-Dutch citizen (not related to origin; I'm married to a non-Dutch myself) having the very unpleasant policy to rip off potential clients through their creditcards (card no. and date of validity as booking deposit) as well as the ones that actually check in and stay at the place (read other reviews). To make sure my husband and I would have a room in A'dam for our 5 day-stay, we initially made (well in advance; two months before flying in) a reservation with Monopole as well as with two other A'dam-based hotels to decide later on which one we would take. There we already faced a 'misunderstanding' regarding the room price: we especially asked for the 95 Euro's room price advertized on all tourist websites and were surprized when the hotel confirmed our reservation (email) in which it mentioned 105 Euro's for the room per night; we had to especially ask them to set the record straight. Chosing our final hotel wasn't too much of a hard choice and ending up at this website which allowed us to read the negative comments about Monopole (below) didn't complicate matters. I thought picking up the phone would be the fastest way to cancel our reservation (as I speak Dutch); it was kind of a surprise to find a female employer who didn't speak a word of Dutch. In English (not very well either) she assured me it wasn't necessary to mail a written confirmation of my cancellation as we were far (5 weeks) ahead from the 48 hours deadline and our initial day of arrival; she would simply take note and skip our reservation...that same night I cancelled two other A'dam-based hotels (Agora and Lieve Nachten) by phone without any problem. Just imagine our astonishment when our monthly creditcard bill of last February showed a debit advice of 105 Euro's for the account of Hotel Monopole on our initial day of arrival; the hotel claims we never cancelled the room ('we can't find anything about your cancellation call in our administration') and says it has been obliged to debit one night according to the '48 hours rule'. Of course, we don't accept these kind of illegal practices and our creditcard company is currenty busy handling this affair accordingly. So, let this be a clear warning; stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We where staying at the Monopole during Easter and had a lovely time in Amsterdam. The location was perfect: near Remdrand Square, the flower market and our room had a great view over the Amstel River. The staff was friendly and very helpfull to advise us on restaurants recommendations (Sampurna at the flower market is a very good Indonesian and Casa di David is the best Italian in town probably!). Our room was clean and nicely furnished. In spite of other reviews: There is no address of the hotel printed on the key card of the room. We will certainly stay at the Monopole again on our next trip as we feld safe and welcomed there in a charming way!

Reviews.Title: “Cess pool run by thieves”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple---this hotel is a sham. Do not believe the web site. The rooms are filthy, and the manager/employees are con artists. You will be asked to pay for your room immediately, and then shown a room. Likely, you will not have the toilet/shower facilities promised to you in your confirmation, nor will you be staying in a secure location. We were fooled, and I am doing everything I can to 1) get my money back--- which they said they would refund to our credit card, but have not done; and 2) expose the thieves that are running this farce. You'd be better off sleeping at the train station. That being said, don't skip Amsterdam--it's a wonderful city. We managed to find a terrific hotel (Canal House) that was slightly more expensive but WELL worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Club 18-30 germs and diseases”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend recently rented two single rooms in the 'hotel' Monopole, Amstel 60, Amsterdam, to the tune of €60 per night for four nights (€250 + city tax) on October 11th -14th. My heart sank when we got a look at the first room; a small, dank place with twin cots, dirty marks on one wall, a tatty thin carpet, old fixtures and fittings and a unpleasant view of what appeared to be an industrial building with a grimy roof. The second room three floors up a break- neck stairs into the attic, was similar to the first but icy cold and dull in the day time, with more dirty marks and a fist-sized hole in one wall. The single sheets which covered the matresses seemed clean but the lank duvets on top looked like they hadn't been washed in several weeks; there was a dark brown cigarette burn hole in one. Having viewed the warm and inviting looking rooms on their website, my friend and I were quite upset about the arrangement. When I asked to be moved from the attic to another room, I was told that we had gotten a special offer and that 'rooms in this part of Amsterdam generally go for €90 or more'. We had to lug our own bags to our rooms. That night we discovered that the club behind (ironically called 'Escape' - at this stage I wanted to) had little to no sound-proofing and that it went on until 4.30am (bar Mondays when it shut its doors at 2am). Strangely, the hotel Monopole makes no mention of this or the bar/club right next door to them on their website. On the third evening when we arrived back at the hotel, we found our towels hadn't been changed, or rooms/ toilets cleaned or toilet rolls replaced. In fact the only thing touched and removed was the cups we had requested (much to their astonishment) the night before. Some kind of hammering and building was going on in one of the rooms for much of the time we were there (daytime only). My view of Amsterdam was sullied by the very poor accomodation and lax approach offered at the hotel Monopole. However, aside from the hotel, I did get to see beautiful Dutch architecture, ground-breaking painting, creative theatre, layers of history and the wonderful buzz of such a diverse European city.

Reviews.Title: “only if you are unconscious”
Reviews.Author: whippoboy
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Hotel Monopole in late Sept. 03, based on two fairly good reviews that I had found. My room was for 75 Euros which I knew was not the best but....... The room was dumpy, had no view and no inroom bath (the latter I expected). However, as far as I know, there was no shower to share nearby so only an inroom sink in which to wash. Small toilet was outside the door. In addition, contrary to what is said, there is no breakfast served. Worse (at least for me) was the fact that the Hotel is flush up against a club that goes until 4 a.m. so unless you're going to be out that late, you can forget about sleep. Very bad security policy as they PUT THE NAME OF THE HOTEL AND YOUR ROOM NUMBER ON THE KEY CARD apparently as a convenience to the clientele (and obviously to anyone who finds your card). I was charged 20 Euros for a lost key card on the grounds that they would have to redo the entire system because of their idiotic policy. In addition, I was initially told they did not have a duplicate to lend to me (apparently as some sort of punishment for having lost the card) so my hours were restricted to those of the staff. Turned out this was not true as they did have another card. This place is basically a flop house where you can come back to pass out in mid-morning. I can't imagine why anyone would choose it over a hostel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Monopole
HotelInfo.Address: Amstel 60, Amsterdam 1017 AC, The Netherlands
